trans-unit.source: Sends the specified message to one of more windows

seg-source.mrk: Sends the specified message to one of more windows

target.mrk: Sends the specified message to one of more windows

trans-unit.source: Parameters
Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message.

target.mrk: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message.

trans-unit.source: The message to be sent.
[optional] The message-specific information.
[optional] The message-specific information.
[optional] The duration, in milliseconds, of the time-out period. If the message is a broadcast message, each

seg-source.mrk: The duration, in milliseconds, of the time-out period.
If the message is a broadcast message, each

target.mrk: The duration, in milliseconds, of the time-out period.
If the message is a broadcast message, each

trans-unit.source: window can use the full time-out period. Default is 1000.

seg-source.mrk: window can use the full time-out period.

target.mrk: window can use the full time-out period.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The flags that specifies how to send the message.

seg-source.mrk: The flags that specifies how to send the message.

target.mrk: The flags that specifies how to send the message.

trans-unit.source: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

target.mrk: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

trans-unit.source: $SMTO_BLOCK
$SMTO_NORMAL
$SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG
$SMTO_NOTIMEOUTIFNOTHUNG
$SMTO_ERRORONEXIT
Return Value
The result of the message processing, depends on the message sent.

seg-source.mrk: The result of the message processing, depends on the message sent.

target.mrk: The result of the message processing, depends on the message sent.

trans-unit.source: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended contains _WinAPI_GetLastError().

seg-source.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended contains _WinAPI_GetLastError().

target.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended contains _WinAPI_GetLastError().

trans-unit.source: Remarks
This function does not provide information about individual windows timing out if $HWND_BROADCAST is used.

seg-source.mrk: This function does not provide information about individual windows timing out if $HWND_BROADCAST is used.

target.mrk: This function does not provide information about individual windows timing out if $HWND_BROADCAST is used.

trans-unit.source: If times out, function fails. If @extended is $ERROR_TIMEOUT (1460), then the function timed out.

seg-source.mrk: If @extended is $ERROR_TIMEOUT (1460), then the function timed out.

target.mrk: If @extended is $ERROR_TIMEOUT (1460), then the function timed out.

trans-unit.source: This function considers a thread is not responding if it has not responds within five seconds.

seg-source.mrk: This function considers a thread is not responding if it has not responds within five seconds.

target.mrk: This function considers a thread is not responding if it has not responds within five seconds.

trans-unit.source: The system only does marshalling for system messages (those in the range 0 to (WM_USER-1)). To send other messages

seg-source.mrk: The system only does marshalling for system messages (those in the range 0 to (WM_USER-1)).

target.mrk: The system only does marshalling for system messages (those in the range 0 to (WM_USER-1)).

trans-unit.source: (those >= WM_USER) to another process, you must do custom marshalling.

seg-source.mrk: (those >= WM_USER) to another process, you must do custom marshalling.

target.mrk: (those >= WM_USER) to another process, you must do custom marshalling.

trans-unit.source: See Also
Search SendMessageTimeout in MSDN Library.
